article.Heading: Jaitley restates 7.5% GDP aim amid global challenge at FSDC meet
article.Summary: The Finance Minister took stock of the economy with all the financial regulators, reiterating the government's growth target of around 7.5 percent, while acknowledging the fact that the global situation remains challenging.
article.Body:
Arun Jaitley chaired a financial stability and development council (FSDC) meet in the North Block on Wednesday.

The Finance Minister took stock of the economy with all the financial regulators, reiterating the government's growth target of around 7.5 percent, while acknowledging the fact that the global situation remains challenging.

He also took heart from the fact that tax collections have shown a consistent rise in the first nine months of this fiscal.

Hemant G Contractor, Chairman, Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority also brought up issues like streamlining of operations and reiterated the proposal to make National Pension Scheme (NPS) an Exempt Exempt Exempt (EEE) product.
